title: Microsoft Windows XP Professional SP3 x86 LunaIzed
description:
Microsoft Windows XP Professional SP3 x86 (English) Luna'Ized

I created this XP by replacing all of the boring old XP icons with the nice high pixelated Vista icons!


Image links where not allowed so I put them in the download folder.


Windows XP gives you the freedom to do what you want at home and at work simply, reliably, and more securely.

This is based on my original Windows XP Professional with Service Pack 3 VL CD. It did of course come with a genuine VLK key which also comes with this release.

I haven't made any unattended configurations to this release so you need to write the key down provided ready for installation.

This XP is compatible for every device for all manufacturers, so you can install it on a SATA hard drive. I have integrated it with every Windows and Microsoft critical updates up-to August 2008. There is one last thing that I slipstreamed, the Windows Vista Sidebar.

Nothing is removed apart from the directories which are used to upgrade, sorry for any dissapointment. :)

-----------------------------
P29GV-PW3QT-2F97Q-6YDHC-PQT9W , this is also available in CD KEY.txt
--------------------^--------
Remember to write this down ready for installation.

The CD key is of course genuine and will allow Windows updates etc, so don't worry about that.

File hashes of GRTMPVOL_EN.ISO;
------------
MD5 : 3C0F3037BEE237E5558A1C9EC601BE48
SHA1 : E3DDDA1D055EEAE0AC9F7E83FA15C70E42A494C0
CRC-32 : 80E12147

Once you have finished downloading this file I strongly recommend you to check the file hashes. A software which enables you to do this can be found here; <a href="
http://beeblebrox.org/hashtab/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://beeblebrox.org/hashtab/</a>

How to;

1.Burn 'GRTMPVOL_EN.ISO' to CD/DVD using an ISO burning software, for example;
http://www.ntfs.com/iso-burning.htm
2.Boot from CD/DVD, make sure your bios settings are set to boot from CD/DVD first!
3.Install by following on screen instructions
4.Most importantly, don't forget to write down the CD key.

Your valuable comments are greatly appreciated

I hope you all like it!, and if you do please seed :)

P.S. My uploading speeds tend to start really slow, but eventually it should speed up :)

For more info on what Windows XP is visit: http://www.microsoft.com/windows/windows-xp/
